documentation.description: Dumps temporary packet information to a file.
Displays the local IP address used to connect to Battle.net.
Lists all of the bot's currently loaded scripts.
documentation.specialnotes: Names encased in parenthesis means the script is disabled.

documentation.description: Enables the specified script.
The name of the script you want to enable.
Disables the specified script.
The name of the script you want to disable.
Returns additional details about the specified script.
The name of the script you want to get information about.
Executes the provided visual basic script code.
The raw VBS code to be executed.
Returns initialization performance information about currently loaded scripts.
The name of the script you want to get information about.
Makes the specified user's name appear red inbot.
documentation.specialnotes: The username specified may include wildcards.

documentation.description: The name of the person you wish to watch.
documentation.specialnotes: May contain wildcards

documentation.description: Stops watching for a user, They will no longer shop up as red.
Clears all of the text in the bot's chat window.
Makes the bot attempt to connect to Battle.net
Disconnects the bot from Battle.net.
Finds users who match the search criteria.
documentation.specialnotes: The username may contain wildcards.

documentation.description: The username to search for, May contain Wildcards, Or the Rank to search for.
Will find users Between this rank and the rank specified in the first parameter
documentation.specialnotes: The first parameter must be numeric.

documentation.description: Lists all of the members of the specified group.
The name of the group.
Retreives any stored mail for the requesting user.
documentation.specialnotes: The 'inbox' version can be used with the bot's trigger or, '!'. EXA: !inbox

documentation.description: Returns the number of pending mail the user has.
States the specified users's rank and flags.
The username to search for.
States a random value between 0 and the specified value. (Defaults to 100)
The maximum value to roll.
Stores a message for the specified user.
The recipient of the message.
The message to be sent.
Initiates a coin toss and states the results.
States all users with the specified flag(s).
The flag(s) of the search query.
Silently clears the outgoing message queue.
Clears the outgoing chat message queue.
States the requesting user's rank and flags.
Creates or modifies a specified database entry.
The name of the user/group to modify.
The rank to set the user to.
The attributes to give the user.
Database administrator.
Shitlisted.
Clan commands.
Auto-designation.
Friend.
General.
Ignored from broad database entries. (client/clan access and wildcards)
Locked from modification.
Operator commands.
Protected.
Safelisted.
Speech commands.
States the address of the server that the bot is currently connected to.
States the bot's version information.
States the requesting user's connection latency with the Battle.net server.
States the current string used for command identification.
documentation.specialnotes: This command can be executed with the trigger '?', EXA: ?trigger

documentation.description: States the current system time.
Initiates a tally of "yes" and "no" responses.
The duration of the voting session, in seconds.
Initiates a tally of "yes" and "no" responses, potentially resulting in the banning of a specified user from the channel.
The username to initiate a tally for.
Initiates a tally of "yes" and "no" responses, potentially resulting in the kicking of a specified user from the channel.
The username to initiate a tally for.
States the results for the most recent or currently active vote.
States basic information about a specified user residing within the channel.
The username to find information on.
Echos a specified phrase, placing a space after each character.
States the result of specified mathematical expression.
The mathematical expression to evalulate.
States the channel that the bot is currently residing within.
States the safelist status of a specified user or tag.
The username or group to check.
Stops all votes that are currently in progress.
States the owner of the bot.
States the currently playing track from a compatibile media player running on the local computer.
Echos a specified phrase

restriction.name: COMMAND_USAGE
restriction.error: You are not allowed to use commands in your message.

documentation.description: Echos a specified phrase using all capital letters.
Instructs the bot to squelch a specified user.
The user to ignore.

restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: Instructs the bot to unsquelch a specified user.
The user to unignore.
Adds a quote to the quote database.
The quote to add.
Echos a random quote from the quote database.
Instructs the bot to set an away message using the specified phrase.
The desired away message. If this is not included, will disable the away message.
Instructs the bot to clear any currently set away message.
States a specified user's latency with the Battle.net server if the user is present within the current channel.
The user to ping.
States the current system and application operational times.
Instructs the bot to remove a specified user from the bot's friends list.
The user to remove from the bot's friends list.
States the current number of users that have been banned from the channel.
Reports the number of users currently on the bot's internal ban list.
States the last fifteen users that the bot has seen.
States the minimum level permissible for WarCraft III users joining the channel.
The minum level a user has to be to not be banned.
States the minimum level permissible for Diablo II users joining the channel.
The minum level a user has to be to not be banned.
Checks if the specified user is on the bot's shitlist.
The name of the user to check.
Displays database information regarding the specified user.
The user to get information about.
States if a specified user matches a tagban.
The user to check.
Instructs the bot to add a specified user to the bot's friends list.
The user to add to the bot's friends list.
Temporarily removes a user from the channel.
The user to remove from the channel.
documentation.specialnotes: The username may include wildcards.

restriction.name: SAFELIST_BYPASS
restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: The reason why this user was removed from the channel.

documentation.specialnotes: The username may include wildcards.

documentation.description: The reason why this user was removed from the channel.

documentation.description: States the name of the user whom last privately messaged the bot.

The phrase to be added to the ban list.

documentation.description: The message to be used when banning the user.
Enables, Disables, or displays the status of the bot's IP banning system.
The sub-command to use. 'On', 'Off', or 'Status'
States all users that the bot has banned during the duration of its role as channel moderator.
States the users currently on the shitlist.
Removes a specified user from the shitlist.
The user to remove from the shitlist.
Safelists a specified user or group of users.
The username or group to add to the safelist.
documentation.specialnotes: May include wildcards.

documentation.description: Removes a safelist entry for a specifed user or group of users.
The username or group to remove from the safelist.
States the users currently on the safelist.
States the tags currently on the tagban list.
Adds a specified tag to the tagban list.
The tag to add to the ban list.
The ban message to use when banning users who match this tag.
Removes a specifed tag from the tagban list.
The tag to remove from the ban list.
Adds a specified user to the shitlist.

restriction.name: SAFELIST_BYPASS
restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: The message to be used when banning this person.
Allows the requesting user to enable, disable, or check the status of, channel protection.
The subcommand to use, must be: 'on', 'off', or 'status'
Enables, disables, or changes the settings of, a welcome message.
The subcommand to use, must be: 'on', 'off', or 'whisper'
The whisper subcommand to use, must be: 'on', or 'off'
States the specified user's Battle.net user profile.
documentation.specialnotes: If used in the bot, will display profile information in a special window.

documentation.description: The username of the person to get profile information for.
Gets the bot's account's information from Battle.net.
Toggles or displays the use of private messaging as a means for delivering command responses.
The subcommand to use, Status, On, or Off
Filters any incoming messages containing the specified phrase.
The phrase to filter, may contains wildcards.
Stops filtering any incoming messages containing the specified phrase.
The phrase to unfilter, may contains wildcards.
Filters any incoming message from the specified user.
The username to block, may contains wildcards.
Stops filtering any incoming message from the specified user.
The username to block, may contains wildcards.
Toggels the use of mp3 commands.
Enables, disables, or displays the status of kicking users from the channel when they yell.
The subcommand to use, must be: 'on', 'off', or 'status'
Lists all of the bot's currently banned clients.
Adds the specified client to the bot's list of banned clients.
The four character code of the client to add.
documentation.specialnotes: STAR - Starcraft Original SEXP - Starcraft BroodWars D2DV - Diablo II D2XP - Diablo II: Lord of Destructions W2BN - Warcraft II: Battle.Net Eddition WAR3 - Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos W3XP - Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

documentation.description: The message to use when banning this client from the channel.
removes the specified client from the bot's list of banned clients.
the client to remove.
The "plugban" command will enable, disable, or state the status of, UDP plug banning.
The sub-command to use. 'On', 'Off', or 'Status'
The "phrasebans" command will enable, disable, or state the status of, phrase banning.
The sub-command to use. 'On', 'Off', or 'Status'
Will attempt to use iTunes as the target media player for use with mp3 commands.
Will attempt to use Winamp as the target media player for use with mp3 commands.
Will set the bot's idle to the specified message.
The message to be used.
Set the bot's idle message to the specified type.
The type to set the idle to, [Message, Quote, Uptime, MP3]
documentation.specialnotes: Message, Msg: The bot will send the message set by the command 'setidle'. Quotes, Quote: The bot will send a randomly select line from it's quotes database. Uptime: The bot will send a message detailing how long the system, and connection has bee active. MP3: The bot will send a message with details about the current song playing in the local computer's media player.

documentation.description: Sets the bot's idle delay to the specified numer of minutes.
The number of minuets between each idle message.
Toggles the selected media player's repeat setting.
Forces the bot to attempt to reconnect to the selected Battle.net server.
Designates or displays the heir to the channel moderator position.
documentation.specialnotes: The bot must have operator status in the channel.

documentation.description: The username to designate.

restriction.name: SAFELIST_BYPASS
restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: Sets the bot's command identifier to the specified.
The command indentifier to set to.
Makes the bot ignore all messages within private chat channels from users not on the bot's friends list.
Makes the bot unignore all messages within private chat channels from users not on the bot's friends list.
Removes a specified user from the bot's database.
The username or group to remove from the database.
Sets the bot's home channel to the channel specified.
The channel to set as home.
Enables or disables the use of idle messages.
'On' or 'Off', to enable or disable the idle.
Toggles the use of shuffle mode for the selected media player.
Pauses or resumes playback in the selected media player.
Toggles fade-out stop for the the selected media player.
Changes the selected media player's volume to the specified level.
The value to set the volume to, in percentage (0-100).
Terminates playback in the currently selected media player.
Begins playback in the currently selected media player.
documentation.specialnotes: If a song is specified, it will attempt to play that song.

documentation.description: The number, title, or partial title of the song you wish to play.
Skips to the next playlist entry in the selected media player's playlist.
Skips to the pevious playlist entry in the selected media player's playlist.
Will attempt to ban all users within the specified channel.
The bot will attempt to ban the users who are in this channel.
Attempts to ignore (squelch) all users within the specified channel.
The bot will attempt to squilch the users who are in this channel.
Allows the requesting user to check or change the status of idle banning.
The Sub Command to use, On, Off, Kick, Delay, Status
documentation.specialnotes: 'On [Time]': Turn idlebans on, if time is specified, sets the delay in seconds. 'Off': Disables idlebans 'Kick [On/Off]': Changes the system to kick the user instead of ban them. 'Delay Time': Changes the delay before kicking/banning idles users to Time seconds. 'Status': Displays information, Delay time, Kick or Ban, Enabled or disabled

documentation.description: Subcommand specific value, On, Off, or number of seconds.
Changes the bot's CD-Key configuration entry to the one specified.
The new cdkey to use in the bot.
Changes the bot's expansion CD-Key configuration entry to the one specified.
The new cdkey to use in the bot.
Adds a specified user to the bot's shitlist and will then attempt to ban and ignore the user.
The user or group to exile.

restriction.name: SAFELIST_BYPASS
restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: The reason the user is being exiled.
Removes a specified user from the bot's shitlist, and will then attempt to unban and unignore the user.
The user or group to unexile.
Clears the bot's internal banlist. Used for ban evasion and unbanning wildcards.
Enables or disables clan channel privacy status.
The subcommand to use, Private, Public, Mail, MOTD
documentation.specialnotes: Private: Will make the channel only avalible to clan members. Public: Will allow anyone to join the channel. Mail Message: Will send a message to everyone in your clan who opted to get mail. MOTD Message: Will set your clan's MOTD to Message, Must have oporaters status to use.

documentation.description: The message to be mailed/set.
Enables, disables, changes, or displays the channel password protection.
The subcommand to use, On, Off, Delay, Status.
documentation.specialnotes: On PASSWORD: Will enable channel password prtection, and set the password to PASSWORD. Off: Will disable channel password protection. Delay TIME: Will set the delay to TIME, TIME must be greater than 0 and less than 256. Status: Will display information ont eh current status of channel password protection.

documentation.description: The value to be used by the commands. (Password, or Delay time)
States the contents of a specified file within the bot's directory.
The file you wish to read
Configuration (.ini) files.
Files outside the bot's folder. (..)
Fully qualified paths: 'C:\File.txt'
Makes the bot join the specified channel.
The channel the bot is to join.
Makes the bot join its home channel.
Promotes the specified user in the current WarCraft III clan.
The user to promote.
Displays the clan's current Message of the Day.
Demotes the specified user in the current WarCraft III clan.
The user to demote.
Forces the bot to resign from its status as a channel moderator.
Changes the configuration entry for the username to the username specified.
The username to use next time you login.
Changes the configuration entry for the password to the password specified.
The password to use next time you login.
Changes the configuration entry for the server to the server specified.
The server to use next time you login.
Makes the bot rejoin the current channel.
documentation.specialnotes: This will cause the bot to gracefully join another channel and return. Uses the bot's chat queue, may be slow.

documentation.description: Makes the bot rejoin the current channel.
documentation.specialnotes: This will actually cause the bot to leave chat, and rejoin, as opposed to joining another channel and returning. Bypasses the chat queue, so is faster.

documentation.description: Makes the bot forcefully (attempt to create if not exists) join the specified channel.
The channel to attempt to join.
Enables/disables the use of quiettime, or displays the current status of quiet time.
The sub commands to use, On, Off, or Status, To turn on, turn off, or display the status of quiet time respectivly.
Designates the specified user and resigns from channel moderator position.
The user to give ops to.

restriction.name: SAFELIST_BYPASS
restriction.error: You may not use " or , to override the safelist.

documentation.description: Invites a specified user into the clan in which the bot is a member.

documentation.description: The user to invite.
Makes the specified clan member the chieftain of the bot's clan.
documentation.specialnotes: The bot must be the cheiftain of the clan.

documentation.description: The user to give cheiftain to.
Disbands the bot's current clan.
Sets the clan's message of the day.
The MOTD to set.
Attempts to launch Winamp on the local computer.
Disables the display of incoming chat messages.
Terminates the bot's execution.
Enables, disables, or displays the status of WarCraft III peon banning.
The sub commands to use, On, Off, or Status, To turn on, turn off, or display the status of Warcraft III peon banning respectivly.
Provides additional information on a command such as the format, parameters, and a description of its function.
The command you wish to retrieve information about.
The script that this command is registered to.
Lists each of the commands available to the specified attribute.
The flags you wish to gather commands for. The list will return commands that math ONE or more of these flags.
Lists each of the commands available to the specified rank.
The maximum rank you wish to find commands for.
Unbans, and UnSquelches the selected user.
The user to unban and unsquelch.
Changes the command line for the bot's instance.
The full command line you wish to set. CPath will not work.
Calculate the soundex value of a word.
The word you wish to calculate the soundex value of.
Retreives a number from the Fibonacci sequance.
The index in the Fibonacci sequance you wish to grab.
documentation.specialnotes: Must be less then 10

documentation.description: Shows an example of the DataGrid form.
